description.en: This course is a cultural and intellectual history of the common roots of the Soviet and European Unions in the "Springtime of the Peoples" of 1848 and the concept of "modernity" since the beginning of the 18th century.  Through a close-reading of key political, literary, and cultural texts of the era, this course explores the common questions and different solutions provided in Russia and Europe since 1848 to the problem of modernity:  how to achieve a society based on the integrated ideals of development and democracy.
description.et: See kurusus pakub kultuuriloolise ja mõteteloolise lähenemise Euroopa ja Nõukogude Liidule, otsides mõlemate allikaid 1848. aasta "rahvaste kevades" ja modernsuse mõistes alates 18. sajandi algusest.  Lugedes poliitilisi, kirjanduslike ja kultuuri tekste 19. ja 20. sajandist, see kursus pakub vaatevinkli ühiste küsimuste ja erinevate lahenduste peale mis on Venemaas ja Euroopas ilmunud modernse maailma probleeimile, s.o. kuidas saavutada ühiskonna, mis on ülesehitatud nii arengu kui demokraatia aadetele.

objectives.en: The objective of the course is to offer a comprehensive understanding of Russia's history in the European context. Russia was and is a European state. The course aims at an understanding of Russia's political, social and cultural development until today and localization of these developments in Europe's context. This eases the comprehension of today's phenomena through historical experience.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on Venemaa ajaloo laiem mõistmine Euroopa kontekstis. Venemaa oli ja on Euroopa riik. Kavas on vahendada teadmisi Venemaa poliitilise, sotsiaalse ja kultuurilise arengu kohta kuni tänapäevani ja siduda see Euroopa kontekstiga. Seeläbi muutuvad erinevad tänapäeva fenomenid ajaloost lähtuvalt paremini mõistetavaks.

learning_outcomes.en: After successfully completing the course, students should be able:
learning_outcomes.et: Pärast kursuse lõpetamist on tudeng suuteline:

learning_outcomes.en: - to develop a comparative analysis of the different eras of Russian history since 1700;
learning_outcomes.et: - arendama võrdlevat analüüsi erinevate Vene ajaloo perioodide suhtes 1700 aastast saadik;

learning_outcomes.en: - to put the development of Russian history into the European context;
learning_outcomes.et: - paigutama Venemaa ajaloo arengut Euroopa konteksti;

learning_outcomes.en: - to develop a critical analysis of the expansion of the Russian/Soviet empire;
learning_outcomes.et: - arendama Venemaa/Nõukogude impeeriumi kujundamise kriitilist analüüsi;

learning_outcomes.en: - to analyse and assess the impact of Russia's history on current developments in Russia.
learning_outcomes.et: - analüüsima ja hindama Venemaa ajaloo mõju Venemaa praegustele arengutele ühiskonnas.

description.et:
1. Active class discussion will be assessed according to the following criteria:
- Ability to present motivated arguments
- Capacity to connecting theory and practice

2. Weekly reading responses and a take-home midterm will be assessed according to the following criteria:
- Close reading and identification of textual passages
- Formal knowledge and understanding
- Analytical and synthetic ability
- Connecting concepts and objects

3.  Discussion leaders will be assessed according to the following criteria:
- A page of intelligent quotations, concepts, and questions to help guide and organize the discussion, prepared in advance
- A meeting with me and each other outside of class in office hours to review their page and prepare for discussion
- Ability to pose good questions and guide discussion during class

5.  Midterm exam
- accurate textual passage identification
- contextual interpretation of their significance

6. Dialogue
- Ability to construct an imaginary dialogue among authors read in the class, that accurately reflects the subtleties of their beliefs and attitudes

grade_preconditions.et: Students should submit the written paper and miss no more than two discussions and three lectures

grade_evaluation.et:
Once the minimum requirements for the final assessment are met, the final grade will be awarded according to the following distribution of points:

Work description maximum points
1. discussion participation (15pts)
2. leading group discussion (5pts)
3. weekly reading responses (20pts)
4. take-home midterm exam (20pts)
5. dialogue (20pts)
4. final paper (20pts)
Total max: 100

debt_elimination.et: As agreed with the responsible lecturer.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
